title: Mass-Density Formula
text: Let p(x) be an integrable function representing the radial density of a disk of radius $$r$$. Then the mass of the disk is given by $$m=\int_{0}^{r} 2\pi p\left(x\right) \,dx$$
speech: Let p(x) be an integrable function representing the radial density of a disk of radius  r . Then the mass of the disk is given by  m, is equal to the integral from 0 to r of 2 pi p of x d x

title: Find the integral
